text: Lily of the valley is a flowering plant. It is found in the Northern Hemisphere in Asia and Europe. It is also in the southern Appalachian Mountains in the United States. The scientific name is Convallaria majalis. Lily of the valley is a herbaceous perennial plant. The flower has a sweet scent and also national flower in Finland. The plant is highly poisonous. They bloom in late spring. ==Other websites== *Convallaria majalis fact sheet â€“ NC State University Urban Horticulture Category:Asparagales Category:Flowers Category:Plants of Asia Category:National symbols of Finland
title: Lily of the valley
